column5: of that which has been sung

column2: The Organization of that which has been Sung
What are it's very small and very large parts?
Jakeñ the Wise replied: I will tell you the story. I will begin with the very small things.
The smallest things are organized only according to weight.
In the first place, the heaviest, Stone.
The first is the heaviest: stone.
Fáthel asked: According to Gad, isn't syrup an element?

column5: I see that he is wrong

column2: Jakeñ the Wise said: I see that he is wrong again.
According to Gad, syrup and water are both (separately) among the elements, but according to me, it (syrup) is two elements.
According to Gad, syrup is an element, but I say that it is two elements.

column5: you will see that it will dry out

column2: If syrup is upon a table, we know that it will dry out.

column5: you will see that it will disappear

column2: If water is upon a table, we know that it will vanish.
Thus, syrup is water and flesh.
We understand its majority's being meat by this: In water it slows down and sinks.
Water does not sink in water.
Stone and dirt are not slow in water and they sink.
Wet air and dry air rise in water.
Jakeñ the Wise said: Fire is two elements rubbing.
If elements are beside similar ones, they will slow down and change places.
The fastest and hottest is fire.
